DOC.detailed_description: The investigator propose develop comprehensive , text messaging-based HIV prevention program Ugandan adolescents 18-22 year age . The guide theoretical model Information-Motivation-Behavioral Skills ( IMB ) Model HIV Preventive Behavior . Intervention development iterative : In Phase 1 , investigator identify intervention content `` map . '' Then , online focus group ( FG ) conduct online Ugandan young adult ( n = 40-80 ) confirm program component ( e.g. , social support via Text Buddy , optimal time delivery daily text message ) saliency intend program topic . In Phase 2 , investigation team `` translate '' content bank text message review comprehensiveness inclusion pertinent topic . The final pool message among Ugandan young adult test Content Advisory Council ( CAC ; n = 30 ) ass reaction content , scope , style , tone message . In Phase 3 , investigator merge content software program develop deliver intervention internally conduct functionality test program message . Following , protocol program test beta test 20 Ugandan adult . In Phase 4 , investigator test intervention randomize control trial 200 Ugandan young adult randomly assign either intervention ( n = 100 ) control ( n = 100 ) arm . The main outcome measure focus feasibility ( e.g. , recruitment retention rate ) acceptability ( e.g. , Text Buddy ) . The primary efficacy outcome measure , measure 3-months post-intervention , : ( ) frequency unprotected sex act ; ( b ) sustain sexual abstinence , ( c ) increase HIV test rate . Specific Aims follow : Specific Aim 1 : Design 6-week text messaging-based HIV prevention healthy sexuality program adolescent 18-22 year old . Specific Aim 2 : Pilot test intervention feasibility acceptability among 18- 22-year-old Ugandans . Specific Aim 3 : Obtain preliminary data need larger-scale control trial service study examine program efficacy .
